clinical_study.brief_title: Recurrence Following CT-guided Drainage of 1st Episode Hinchey II Diverticulitis

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: Patients will agree to be randomized to either surgery or non-operative management following a first episode of Hinchey II diverticulitis. Information will also be collected on rates of recurrence rates and major complications in both groups.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will test the feasibility of randomizing patients with a first episode of diverticulitis with abscess defined by CT scan amenable to drainage to observation or elective sigmoid resection. The study will also gather preliminary data on relative safety of surgery and observation.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome in this feasibility study is whether or not patients will agree to be in the trial. Eligible patients will be approached and we will record what proportion of patients agree to participate. For those who decline enrollment, we will ascertain what aspect of the study is not acceptable to them.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure length of hospital stay for surgery vs non surgery patients
secondary_outcome.description: data collected will include length of hospital stay for patients undergoing surgery from day of surgery to discharge day as compared to observation group
Data will be collected on percentage of patients who require emergency surgery after first episode of diverticulitis
Data will be collected on percent of patients who undergo fistula surgery after 1st episode of diverticulitis
Data will be collected on percent of patients who die after first episode diverticulitis due to treatment complications
Data will be collected on percentage of patients readmitted to hospital within 30 days due to complication of treatment
Data will be collected on percent and type of complications for post surgery patients
data will be collected on recurrence and treatment for recurrence of diverticulitis

arm_group.description: The observation group will be followed clinically with no further intervention until the primary endpoint is reached.
The surgery group will be offered colon resection.

study_pop.textblock: All patients with successfully treated first episode diverticulitis and intraabdominal abscess

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- older than or equal to 18
- history of resolved first episode of diverticulitis with abscess (Hinchey class II) who were successfully treated by our standard protocol(see Appendix A)
- the diagnosis confirmed by colonoscopy
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Abscess not amenable to percutaneous drainage
- Prior episode of diverticulitis
- Right sided diverticulitis
- Failure of recovery from first episode, defined as recurrence within one month.
- Cancer found at the site on screening colonoscopy
- Comorbidities prohibiting surgery (as measured by colorectal Possum score)
- Immunosuppressed patients
- Hinchey I, III, or IV
- Patients who are unable to sign the informed consent
